Sentencas: The interaction of SO2 with the yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) (111) and oxygen-enriched YSZ (111) (YSZ+O) surface is investigated using the first-principles method based density functional theory (OFT).
Titulo: Adsorption and oxidation of sulfur dioxide on the yttria-stabilized zirconia surface: ab initio atomistic thermodynamics study

Sentencas: It is found that SO2 is adsorbed either as a molecule or forms SO32- species with new S-O bonds to a surface oxygen on the YSZ (111) surface.
Titulo: Adsorption and oxidation of sulfur dioxide on the yttria-stabilized zirconia surface: ab initio atomistic thermodynamics study

Sentencas: In addition, there exist other species, e.g., SO3 and SO42- on the very active YSZ+O (111) surface.
Titulo: Adsorption and oxidation of sulfur dioxide on the yttria-stabilized zirconia surface: ab initio atomistic thermodynamics study

Sentencas: Using the ab initio atomistic thermodynamics method, we present a detailed analysis on the stability of the SO2-YSZ/YSZ+O system as a function of the ambient conditions.
Titulo: Adsorption and oxidation of sulfur dioxide on the yttria-stabilized zirconia surface: ab initio atomistic thermodynamics study
